column4: hey guys can anyone recommend a good wifi card, cost is not necessarily a factor.
something with support out of the box would rock but is not absolutly required
PCI
does it need draft-n support?
what is draft n? i would like it to see N networks if thats what you mean
see and use
then yes
awus036h is high powered dongle, it sends more power through the radio waves
ebay, etc
couldent find one on newegg
its only available at a few select stores.. there's rokland and data-alliance, etc
which card is this?
i want a good card, pci or usb dosent matter
one was cheap ebay stuff and the other net gear, brb i'll get them and feed you numbers
btw: http://madwifi-project.org/wiki/Compatibility/D-Link
the first was netgear wg111t and it lasted years andf the other was edup something 54m and it lasted about a year, not bad for 10$ shipping included
lol netgear has a poor reputation for versioning their own devices and I had a wg111v2 (latter model) which is trying to kill itself these days, horribly designed and full of lies
yea i got it free so i cant complain
did you not see the link I pasted from madwifi-project ?
i didnt look yet, i was not wanting to be rude
good info there fyi :)
I personally have dwl-g520, a/b/g and works alright
